revised_title: Strata and Fossils Found in Sinking Mineral Wells at Holt
tldr: The author describes the various layers of earth and fossils discovered during the excavation of mineral wells at Holt. The layers include blue clay, yellow clay, loam with selenites, and a bed of hard stones coated with gypsum. The author also mentions the presence of shells, oysters, belemnites, and black bituminous sulfur. The unique composition of these strata gives the mineral wells their remarkable qualities.
